00099 /* Connection handling. */
00100 
00104 typedef struct
00105 {
00106   gnutls_session_t session;     
00107   int socket;                   
00108   gchar *username;              
00109   gchar *password;              
00110   gchar *host_string;           
00111   gchar *port_string;           
00112   gint port;                    
00113   gboolean use_certs;           
00114   gint timeout;                 
00115 } server_connection_t;
00116 
00129 static server_connection_t *
00130 connection_from_file (const gchar * conf_file_path)
00131 {
00132   assert (conf_file_path);
00133   GKeyFile *key_file = g_key_file_new ();
00134   GError *error = NULL;
00135   server_connection_t *connection = g_malloc0 (sizeof (*connection));
00136 
00137   /* Load key file. */
00138   if (g_key_file_load_from_file (key_file, conf_file_path, 0, &error) == FALSE)
00139     {
00140       /* Be chatty about non trivial error (file does exist). */
00141       if (g_file_test (conf_file_path, G_FILE_TEST_EXISTS))
00142         g_warning ("Could not load connection configuration from %s: %s",
00143                    conf_file_path, error->message);
00144 
00145       g_error_free (error);
00146       g_key_file_free (key_file);
00147       return connection;
00148     }
00149 
00150 #if 0
00151   /* Check for completeness. */
00152   if (g_key_file_has_key (key_file, "Connection", "host", &error) == FALSE
00153       || g_key_file_has_key (key_file, "Connection", "port", &error) == FALSE
00154       || g_key_file_has_key (key_file, "Connection", "username",
00155                              &error) == FALSE
00156       || g_key_file_has_key (key_file, "Connection", "password",
00157                              &error) == FALSE)
00158     {
00159       g_warning ("Connection configuration file misses entrie(s): %s",
00160                  error->message);
00161       g_error_free (error);
00162       return NULL;
00163     }
00164 #endif
00165 
00166   /* Fill struct if any values found. */
00167   connection->host_string =
00168     g_key_file_get_string (key_file, "Connection", "host", NULL);
00169   connection->port_string =
00170     g_key_file_get_string (key_file, "Connection", "port", NULL);
00171   connection->username =
00172     g_key_file_get_string (key_file, "Connection", "username", NULL);
00173   connection->password =
00174     g_key_file_get_string (key_file, "Connection", "password", NULL);
00175 
00176   g_key_file_free (key_file);
00177 
00178   return connection;
00179 }
00180 
00190 static gboolean
00191 manager_open (server_connection_t * connection)
00192 {
00193   if (connection->use_certs)
00194     connection->socket = openvas_server_open_with_cert
00195                           (&connection->session, connection->host_string,
00196                            connection->port, CACERT, CLIENTCERT, CLIENTKEY);
00197   else
00198     connection->socket = openvas_server_open
00199                           (&connection->session, connection->host_string,
00200                            connection->port);
00201 
00202   if (connection->socket == -1)
00203     {
00204       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to acquire socket.\n");
00205       exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00206     }
00207 
00208   if (connection->use_certs)
00209     return TRUE;
00210 
00211   if (connection->username && connection->password)
00212     {
00213       if (omp_authenticate
00214           (&connection->session, connection->username, connection->password))
00215         {
00216           openvas_server_close (connection->socket, connection->session);
00217           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to authenticate.\n");
00218           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00219         }
00220     }
00221 
00222   return TRUE;
00223 }
00224 
00230 static int
00231 manager_close (server_connection_t * server)
00232 {
00233   return openvas_server_close (server->socket, server->session);
00234 }

00243 static int
00244 print_tasks (entities_t tasks)
00245 {
00246   entity_t task;
00247   while ((task = first_entity (tasks)))
00248     {
00249       if (strcmp (entity_name (task), "task") == 0)
00250         {
00251           entity_t entity, report;
00252           entities_t reports;
00253           const char *id, *name, *status, *progress;
00254 
00255           id = entity_attribute (task, "id");
00256           if (id == NULL)
00257             {
00258               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse task ID.\n");
00259               return -1;
00260             }
00261 
00262           entity = entity_child (task, "name");
00263           if (entity == NULL)
00264             {
00265               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse task name.\n");
00266               return -1;
00267             }
00268           name = entity_text (entity);
00269 
00270           entity = entity_child (task, "status");
00271           if (entity == NULL)
00272             {
00273               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse task status.\n");
00274               return -1;
00275             }
00276           status = entity_text (entity);
00277 
00278           entity = entity_child (task, "progress");
00279           if (entity == NULL)
00280             {
00281               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse task progress.\n");
00282               return -1;
00283             }
00284           progress = entity_text (entity);
00285 
00286           printf ("%s  %-7s", id, status);
00287           if (strcmp (status, "Running") == 0)
00288             printf (" %2s%%  %s\n", progress, name);
00289           else
00290             printf ("      %s\n", name);
00291 
00292           /* Print any reports indented under the task. */
00293 
00294           entity = entity_child (task, "reports");
00295           if (entity == NULL)
00296             {
00297               tasks = next_entities (tasks);
00298               continue;
00299             }
00300 
00301           reports = entity->entities;
00302           while ((report = first_entity (reports)))
00303             {
00304               if (strcmp (entity_name (report), "report") == 0)
00305                 {
00306                   entity_t result_count;
00307                   const char *id, *status, *holes, *infos, *logs, *warnings;
00308                   const char *time_stamp;
00309 
00310                   id = entity_attribute (report, "id");
00311                   if (id == NULL)
00312                     {
00313                       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse report ID.\n");
00314                       return -1;
00315                     }
00316 
00317                   entity = entity_child (report, "scan_run_status");
00318                   if (entity == NULL)
00319                     {
00320                       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse report status.\n");
00321                       return -1;
00322                     }
00323                   status = entity_text (entity);
00324 
00325                   result_count = entity_child (report, "result_count");
00326                   if (result_count == NULL)
00327                     {
00328                       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse report result_count.\n");
00329                       return -1;
00330                     }
00331 
00332                   entity = entity_child (result_count, "hole");
00333                   if (entity == NULL)
00334                     {
00335                       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse report hole.\n");
00336                       return -1;
00337                     }
00338                   holes = entity_text (entity);
00339 
00340                   entity = entity_child (result_count, "info");
00341                   if (entity == NULL)
00342                     {
00343                       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse report info.\n");
00344                       return -1;
00345                     }
00346                   infos = entity_text (entity);
00347 
00348                   entity = entity_child (result_count, "log");
00349                   if (entity == NULL)
00350                     {
00351                       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse report log.\n");
00352                       return -1;
00353                     }
00354                   logs = entity_text (entity);
00355 
00356                   entity = entity_child (result_count, "warning");
00357                   if (entity == NULL)
00358                     {
00359                       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse report warning.\n");
00360                       return -1;
00361                     }
00362                   warnings = entity_text (entity);
00363 
00364                   entity = entity_child (report, "timestamp");
00365                   if (entity == NULL)
00366                     {
00367                       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse report timestamp.\n");
00368                       return -1;
00369                     }
00370                   time_stamp = entity_text (entity);
00371 
00372                   printf ("  %s  %-7s  %2s  %2s  %2s  %2s  %s\n", id, status,
00373                           holes, warnings, infos, logs, time_stamp);
00374                 }
00375               reports = next_entities (reports);
00376             }
00377         }
00378       tasks = next_entities (tasks);
00379     }
00380   return 0;
00381 }

00390 static int
00391 print_configs (entities_t configs)
00392 {
00393   entity_t config;
00394   while ((config = first_entity (configs)))
00395     {
00396       if (strcmp (entity_name (config), "config") == 0)
00397         {
00398           entity_t entity;
00399           const char *id, *name;
00400 
00401           id = entity_attribute (config, "id");
00402           if (id == NULL)
00403             {
00404               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse config ID.\n");
00405               return -1;
00406             }
00407 
00408           entity = entity_child (config, "name");
00409           if (entity == NULL)
00410             {
00411               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse config name.\n");
00412               return -1;
00413             }
00414           name = entity_text (entity);
00415 
00416           printf ("%s  %s\n", id, name);
00417         }
00418       configs = next_entities (configs);
00419     }
00420   return 0;
00421 }

00430 static int
00431 print_targets (entities_t targets)
00432 {
00433   entity_t target;
00434   while ((target = first_entity (targets)))
00435     {
00436       if (strcmp (entity_name (target), "target") == 0)
00437         {
00438           entity_t entity;
00439           const char *id, *name;
00440 
00441           id = entity_attribute (target, "id");
00442           if (id == NULL)
00443             {
00444               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse target ID.\n");
00445               return -1;
00446             }
00447 
00448           entity = entity_child (target, "name");
00449           if (entity == NULL)
00450             {
00451               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse target name.\n");
00452               return -1;
00453             }
00454           name = entity_text (entity);
00455 
00456           printf ("%s  %s\n", id, name);
00457         }
00458       targets = next_entities (targets);
00459     }
00460   return 0;
00461 }
00462 
00472 int
00473 get_configs (gnutls_session_t* session, entity_t* status)
00474 {
00475   const char* status_code;
00476   int ret;
00477 
00478   if (openvas_server_sendf (session, "<get_configs/>") == -1)
00479     return -1;
00480 
00481   /* Read the response. */
00482 
00483   *status = NULL;
00484   if (read_entity (session, status)) return -1;
00485 
00486   /* Check the response. */
00487 
00488   status_code = entity_attribute (*status, "status");
00489   if (status_code == NULL)
00490     {
00491       free_entity (*status);
00492       return -1;
00493     }
00494   if (strlen (status_code) == 0)
00495     {
00496       free_entity (*status);
00497       return -1;
00498     }
00499   if (status_code[0] == '2') return 0;
00500   ret = (int) strtol (status_code, NULL, 10);
00501   free_entity (*status);
00502   if (errno == ERANGE) return -1;
00503   return ret;
00504 }

00508 /* Commands. */

00518 static int
00519 manager_get_omp_version (server_connection_t * connection, gchar ** version_str)
00520 {
00521   entity_t entity, version;
00522 
00523   if (openvas_server_send (&(connection->session), "<get_version/>")
00524       == -1)
00525     {
00526       manager_close (connection);
00527       return -1;
00528     }
00529 
00530   /* Read the response. */
00531 
00532   entity = NULL;
00533   if (read_entity (&(connection->session), &entity))
00534     {
00535       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to read response.\n");
00536       manager_close (connection);
00537       return -1;
00538     }
00539 
00540   version = entity_child (entity, "version");
00541   if (version == NULL)
00542     {
00543       free_entity (entity);
00544       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse version.\n");
00545       manager_close (connection);
00546       return -1;
00547     }
00548 
00549   *version_str = g_strdup (entity_text(version));
00550 
00551   free_entity (entity);
00552 
00553   return 0;
00554 }
00555 
00569 static int
00570 manager_get_reports (server_connection_t * connection, gchar ** report_ids,
00571                      gchar * format)
00572 {
00573   gchar *version = NULL;
00574   gchar *default_format = NULL;
00575   gchar *format_req_str = NULL;
00576 
00577   if (manager_get_omp_version (connection, &version))
00578     {
00579       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to determine OMP version.\n");
00580       manager_close (connection);
00581       return -1;
00582     }
00583 
00584   if (strcmp (version, "1.0") == 0)
00585     {
00586       default_format = "XML";
00587       format_req_str = "format";
00588     }
00589   else if (strcmp (version, "2.0") == 0)
00590     {
00591       default_format = "d5da9f67-8551-4e51-807b-b6a873d70e34";
00592       format_req_str = "format_id";
00593     }
00594   else
00595     {
00596       default_format = "a994b278-1f62-11e1-96ac-406186ea4fc5";
00597       format_req_str = "format_id";
00598     }
00599 
00600   g_free (version);
00601 
00602   if (format == NULL || strcasecmp (format, default_format) == 0)
00603     {
00604       entity_t entity, report_xml;
00605 
00606       if (openvas_server_sendf (&(connection->session),
00607                                 "<get_reports"
00608                                 " result_hosts_only=\"0\""
00609                                 " first_result=\"0\""
00610                                 " sort_field=\"ROWID\""
00611                                 " sort_order=\"1\""
00612                                 " %s=\"%s\""
00613                                 " report_id=\"%s\"/>",
00614                                 format_req_str,
00615                                 format ? format :
00616                                 default_format,
00617                                 *report_ids))
00618         {
00619           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get report.\n");
00620           manager_close (connection);
00621           return -1;
00622         }
00623 
00624       if (read_entity (&connection->session, &entity)) {
00625         fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get report.\n");
00626         manager_close (connection);
00627         return -1;
00628       }
00629 
00630       report_xml = entity_child (entity, "report");
00631       if (report_xml == NULL)
00632         {
00633           free_entity (entity);
00634           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get report.\n");
00635           manager_close (connection);
00636           return -1;
00637         }
00638 
00639       print_entity (stdout, report_xml);
00640     }
00641   else
00642     {
00643       guchar *report = NULL;
00644       gsize report_size = 0;
00645       char first;
00646       const char* status;
00647       entity_t entity;
00648 
00649       if (openvas_server_sendf (&(connection->session),
00650                                 "<get_reports %s=\"%s\" report_id=\"%s\"/>",
00651                                 format_req_str,
00652                                 format,
00653                                 *report_ids))
00654         {
00655           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get report.\n");
00656           manager_close (connection);
00657           return -1;
00658         }
00659 
00660       /* Read the response. */
00661 
00662       entity = NULL;
00663       if (read_entity (&connection->session, &entity))
00664         {
00665           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get report.\n");
00666           manager_close (connection);
00667           return -1;
00668         }
00669 
00670       /* Check the response. */
00671 
00672       status = entity_attribute (entity, "status");
00673       if (status == NULL)
00674         {
00675           free_entity (entity);
00676           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get report.\n");
00677           manager_close (connection);
00678           return -1;
00679         }
00680       if (strlen (status) == 0)
00681         {
00682           free_entity (entity);
00683           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get report.\n");
00684           manager_close (connection);
00685           return -1;
00686         }
00687       first = status[0];
00688       if (first == '2')
00689         {
00690           const char* report_64;
00691           entity_t report_xml;
00692 
00693           report_xml = entity_child (entity, "report");
00694           if (report_xml == NULL)
00695             {
00696               free_entity (entity);
00697               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get report.\n");
00698               manager_close (connection);
00699               return -1;
00700             }
00701 
00702           report_64 = entity_text (report_xml);
00703           if (strlen (report_64) == 0)
00704             {
00705               report = (guchar *) g_strdup ("");
00706               report_size = 0;
00707             }
00708           else
00709             {
00710               report = g_base64_decode (report_64, &report_size);
00711             }
00712 
00713           free_entity (entity);
00714         }
00715       else
00716         {
00717           free_entity (entity);
00718           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get report.\n");
00719           manager_close (connection);
00720           return -1;
00721         }
00722 
00723       if (fwrite (report, 1, report_size, stdout) < report_size)
00724         {
00725           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to write entire report.\n");
00726           manager_close (connection);
00727           return -1;
00728         }
00729       g_free (report);
00730     }
00731 
00732   return 0;
00733 }
00734 
00742 static int
00743 manager_get_report_formats (server_connection_t * connection)
00744 {
00745   entity_t entity, format;
00746   entities_t formats;
00747 
00748   if (openvas_server_send (&(connection->session), "<get_report_formats/>")
00749       == -1)
00750     {
00751       manager_close (connection);
00752       return -1;
00753     }
00754 
00755   /* Read the response. */
00756 
00757   entity = NULL;
00758   if (read_entity (&(connection->session), &entity))
00759     {
00760       fprintf (stderr, "Failed to read response.\n");
00761       manager_close (connection);
00762       return -1;
00763     }
00764 
00765   formats = entity->entities;
00766   while ((format = first_entity (formats)))
00767     {
00768       if (strcmp (entity_name (format), "report_format") == 0)
00769         {
00770           const char *id;
00771           entity_t name;
00772 
00773           id = entity_attribute (format, "id");
00774           if (id == NULL)
00775             {
00776               free_entity (entity);
00777               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse report format ID.\n");
00778               manager_close (connection);
00779               return -1;
00780             }
00781 
00782           name = entity_child (format, "name");
00783           if (name == NULL)
00784             {
00785               free_entity (entity);
00786               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to parse report format name.\n");
00787               manager_close (connection);
00788               return -1;
00789             }
00790 
00791           printf ("%s  %s\n", id, entity_text (name));
00792         }
00793       formats = next_entities (formats);
00794     }
00795 
00796   free_entity (entity);
00797 
00798   return 0;
00799 }
00800 
00816 #ifndef _WIN32
00817 ssize_t
00818 read_password (char **lineptr, size_t *n, FILE *stream)
00819 {
00820   struct termios old, new;
00821   int nread;
00822 
00823   /* Turn echoing off and fail if we can't. */
00824   if (tcgetattr (fileno (stream), &old) != 0)
00825     return -1;
00826   new = old;
00827   new.c_lflag &= ~ECHO;
00828   if (tcsetattr (fileno (stream), TCSAFLUSH, &new) != 0)
00829     return -1;
00830 
00831   /* Read the password. */
00832   nread = getline (lineptr, n, stream);
00833 
00834   /* Restore terminal. */
00835   (void) tcsetattr (fileno (stream), TCSAFLUSH, &old);
00836 
00837   return nread;
00838 }
00839 #else
00840 ssize_t
00841 read_password (char **lineptr, size_t *n, FILE *stream)
00842 {
00843   HANDLE hConsoleHandle;
00844   DWORD nread;
00845   (void) stream;
00846   unsigned int bufSize = 512;
00847 
00848   if (!lineptr || !n)
00849     {
00850       return -1;
00851     }
00852 
00853   bufSize = *n ? *n : bufSize;
00854 
00855   hConsoleHandle = CreateFile ("CONIN$", GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE,
00856                                0, NULL, OPEN_ALWAYS, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL,
00857                                NULL);
00858 
00859   if (hConsoleHandle == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00860     return -1;
00861 
00862   if (!SetConsoleMode (hConsoleHandle, ENABLE_LINE_INPUT |
00863                        ENABLE_PROCESSED_INPUT))
00864     return -1;
00865 
00866   /* Read the password */
00867   {
00868     wchar_t wcsbuf[bufSize];
00869     int n2;
00870     ReadConsoleW (hConsoleHandle, &wcsbuf, bufSize - 2, &nread, NULL);
00871     CloseHandle (hConsoleHandle);
00872 
00873     if (nread <= 2)
00874       return -1;
00875 
00876     /* Remove CR/LF */
00877     wcsbuf[nread - 2] = '\n';
00878     wcsbuf[nread - 1] = '\0';
00879 
00880     /* Convert to UTF-8 */
00881     n2 = WideCharToMultiByte (CP_UTF8, 0, wcsbuf, nread - 1,
00882                               NULL, 0, NULL, NULL);
00883 
00884     if (n2 < 0)
00885       return -1;
00886 
00887     *lineptr = g_malloc (n2 + 1);
00888 
00889     nread = WideCharToMultiByte (CP_UTF8, 0, wcsbuf, nread - 1,
00890                                  *lineptr, n2, NULL, NULL);
00891     if (nread < 0)
00892       {
00893         g_free (*lineptr);
00894         return -1;
00895       }
00896   }
00897 
00898   return nread;
00899 }
00900 #endif
00901 
00902 
00906 static void
00907 my_gnutls_log_func (int level, const char *text)
00908 {
00909   fprintf (stderr, "[%d] (%d) %s", getpid (), level, text);
00910   if (*text && text[strlen (text) -1] != '\n')
00911     putc ('\n', stderr);
00912 }
00913 
00914 static char *
00915 get_file_base64 (const char *path)
00916 {
00917   GError *error = NULL;
00918   char *content, *encoded;
00919   gsize len;
00920 
00921   if (!g_file_get_contents (path, &content, &len, &error))
00922     {
00923       fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", error->message);
00924       g_error_free (error);
00925       return NULL;
00926     }
00927   encoded = g_base64_encode ((guchar *) content, len);
00928   g_free (content);
00929   return encoded;
00930 }
00931 
00932 static int
00933 replace_send_file_xml (char **xml, const char *path)
00934 {
00935   char *s, *content;
00936   if (!xml || !*xml || !path)
00937     return 1;
00938 
00939   s = strstr (*xml, SENDFILE_STR);
00940   if (!s)
00941     {
00942       fprintf (stderr, "%s not found in xml command.\n", SENDFILE_STR);
00943       return 1;
00944     }
00945   content = get_file_base64 (path);
00946   if (!content)
00947     return 1;
00948   *s = '\0';
00949   s += strlen (SENDFILE_STR);
00950   *xml = g_strdup_printf ("%s%s%s", *xml, content, s);
00951   g_free (content);
00952   return 0;
00953 }
00954 
00955 /* Entry point. */
00956 
00957 int
00958 main (int argc, char **argv)
00959 {
00960   server_connection_t *connection = NULL;
00961   /* The return status of the command. */
00962   int exit_status = -1;
00963 
00964   /* Global options. */
00965   static gboolean prompt = FALSE;
00966   static gboolean print_version = FALSE;
00967   static gboolean be_verbose = FALSE;
00968   static gboolean use_certs = FALSE;
00969   static gchar *conf_file_path = NULL;
00970   static gchar *send_file_path = NULL;
00971   static gchar *manager_host_string = NULL;
00972   static gchar *manager_port_string = NULL;
00973   static gchar *omp_username = NULL;
00974   static gchar *omp_password = NULL;
00975   /* Shared command options. */
00976   static gchar *name = NULL;
00977   /* Command create-task. */
00978   static gboolean cmd_create_task = FALSE;
00979   static gchar *comment = NULL;
00980   static gchar *config = NULL;
00981   static gchar *target = NULL;
00982   /* Command delete-report. */
00983   static gboolean cmd_delete_report = FALSE;
00984   /* Command delete-task. */
00985   static gboolean cmd_delete_task = FALSE;
00986   /* Command get-report. */
00987   static gboolean cmd_get_report = FALSE;
00988   /* Command get-report-formats. */
00989   static gboolean cmd_get_report_formats = FALSE;
00990   /* Command get-omp-version. */
00991   static gboolean cmd_get_omp_version = FALSE;
00992   static gchar *format = NULL;
00993   /* Command get-tasks. */
00994   static gboolean cmd_get_tasks = FALSE;
00995   /* Command get-configs. */
00996   static gboolean cmd_get_configs = FALSE;
00997   /* Command get-targets. */
00998   static gboolean cmd_get_targets = FALSE;
00999   /* Command modify-task. */
01000   static gboolean cmd_modify_task = FALSE;
01001   static gboolean file = FALSE;
01002   /* Command start-task. */
01003   static gboolean cmd_start_task = FALSE;
01004   /* Command ping. */
01005   static gboolean cmd_ping = FALSE;
01006   static gint ping_timeout = DEFAULT_PING_TIMEOUT;
01007   /* Command given as XML. */
01008   static gchar *cmd_xml = NULL;
01009   /* The rest of the args. */
01010   static gchar **rest = NULL;
01011   /* Pretty print option. */
01012   static gboolean pretty_print = FALSE;
01013 
01014   GError *error = NULL;
01015 
01016   GOptionContext *option_context;
01017   static GOptionEntry option_entries[] = {
01018     /* Global options. */
01019     {"host", 'h', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &manager_host_string,
01020      "Connect to manager on host <host>", "<host>"},
01021     {"port", 'p', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &manager_port_string,
01022      "Use port number <number>", "<number>"},
01023     {"version", 'V', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &print_version,
01024      "Print version.", NULL},
01025     {"verbose", 'v', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &be_verbose,
01026      "Verbose messages (WARNING: may reveal passwords).", NULL},
01027     {"use-certs", 0, 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &use_certs,
01028      "Use client certificates to authenticate", NULL},
01029     {"username", 'u', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &omp_username,
01030      "OMP username", "<username>"},
01031     {"password", 'w', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &omp_password,
01032      "OMP password", "<password>"},
01033     {"config-file", 0, 0, G_OPTION_ARG_FILENAME, &conf_file_path,
01034      "Configuration file for connection parameters.", "<config-file>"},
01035     {"prompt", 'P', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &prompt,
01036      "Prompt to exit.", NULL},
01037     {"get-omp-version", 'O', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_get_omp_version,
01038      "Print OMP version.", NULL},
01039     /* Shared command options. */
01040     {"name", 'n', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &name,
01041      "Name for create-task.",
01042      "<name>"},
01043     /* Command create-task. */
01044     {"create-task", 'C', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_create_task,
01045      "Create a task.", NULL},
01046     {"comment", 'm', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &comment,
01047      "Comment for create-task.",
01048      "<name>"},
01049     {"config", 'c', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &config,
01050      "Config for create-task.",
01051      "<config>"},
01052     {"target", 't', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &target,
01053      "Target for create-task.",
01054      "<target>"},
01055     /* Command delete-report. */
01056     {"delete-report", 'E', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_delete_report,
01057      "Delete one or more reports.", NULL},
01058     /* Command delete-task. */
01059     {"delete-task", 'D', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_delete_task,
01060      "Delete one or more tasks.", NULL},
01061     /* Command get-report. */
01062     {"get-report", 'R', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_get_report,
01063      "Get report of one task.", NULL},
01064     {"get-report-formats", 'F', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_get_report_formats,
01065      "Get report formats. (OMP 2.0 only)", NULL},
01066     {"format", 'f', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &format,
01067      "Format for get-report.",
01068      "<format>"},
01069     /* Command get-tasks. */
01070     {"get-tasks", 'G', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_get_tasks,
01071      "Get status of one, many or all tasks.", NULL},
01072     /* Command get-configs. */
01073     {"get-configs", 'g', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_get_configs,
01074      "Get configs.", NULL},
01075     /* Command get-targets. */
01076     {"get-targets", 'T', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_get_targets,
01077      "Get targets.", NULL},
01078     /* Pretty printing for "direct" xml (in combination with -X). */
01079     {"pretty-print", 'i', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &pretty_print,
01080      "In combination with -X, pretty print the response.", NULL},
01081     /* Command start-task. */
01082     {"start-task", 'S', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_start_task,
01083      "Start one or more tasks.", NULL},
01084     /* Command modify-task. */
01085     {"modify-task", 'M', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_modify_task,
01086      "Modify a task.", NULL},
01087     /* Command ping. */
01088     {"ping", 0, 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &cmd_ping,
01089      "Ping OMP server", NULL},
01090     {"timeout", 't', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_INT, &ping_timeout,
01091      "Wait <number> seconds for OMP ping response", "<number>"},
01092     {"file", 0, 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &file,
01093      "Add text in stdin as file on task.", NULL},
01094     /* Command as XML. */
01095     {"xml", 'X', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &cmd_xml,
01096      "XML command (e.g. \"<help/>\"\").  \"-\" to read from stdin.",
01097      "<command>"},
01098     {"send-file", 0, 0, G_OPTION_ARG_FILENAME, &send_file_path,
01099      "Replace SENDFILE in xml with base64 of file.", "<file>"},
01100     {G_OPTION_REMAINING, 0, 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING_ARRAY, &rest,
01101      NULL, NULL},
01102     {NULL}
01103   };
01104 
01105   if (setlocale (LC_ALL, "") == NULL)
01106     {
01107       printf ("Failed to setlocale\n\n");
01108       exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01109     }
01110 
01111   option_context =
01112     g_option_context_new ("- OpenVAS OMP Command Line Interface");
01113   g_option_context_add_main_entries (option_context, option_entries, NULL);
01114   if (!g_option_context_parse (option_context, &argc, &argv, &error))
01115     {
01116       printf ("%s\n\n", error->message);
01117       exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01118     }
01119 
01120   /* Check for Windows style help request */
01121   if (rest != NULL && *rest != NULL)
01122     {
01123       if (g_strstr_len (*rest, -1, "/?") != NULL)
01124         {
01125           printf ("%s", g_option_context_get_help (option_context, TRUE, NULL));
01126           exit (EXIT_SUCCESS);
01127         }
01128     }
01129 
01130   if (print_version)
01131     {
01132       printf ("OMP Command Line Interface %s\n", OPENVASCLI_VERSION);
01133       printf ("Copyright (C) 2010-2013 Greenbone Networks GmbH\n");
01134       printf ("License GPLv2+: GNU GPL version 2 or later\n");
01135       printf
01136         ("This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.\n"
01137          "There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.\n\n");
01138       exit (EXIT_SUCCESS);
01139     }
01140 
01141   /* Check that one and at most one command option is present. */
01142   {
01143     int commands;
01144     commands =
01145       (int) cmd_create_task + (int) cmd_delete_report + (int) cmd_delete_task +
01146       (int) cmd_get_report + (int) cmd_get_report_formats +
01147       (int) cmd_get_tasks + (int) cmd_modify_task + (int) cmd_start_task +
01148       (int) cmd_get_targets + (int) cmd_get_omp_version + (int) cmd_get_configs +
01149       (int) cmd_ping + (int) (cmd_xml != NULL);
01150     if (commands == 0)
01151       {
01152         fprintf (stderr, "One command option must be present.\n");
01153         exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01154       }
01155     if (commands > 1)
01156       {
01157         fprintf (stderr, "Only one command option must be present.\n");
01158         exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01159       }
01160   }
01161 
01162   /* Setup the connection structure from the arguments and conf file.
01163    * Precedence of values is the following:
01164    * 1) command line argument (e.g. --port) 2) conf file 3) default */
01165 
01166   if (conf_file_path == NULL)
01167     conf_file_path = g_build_filename (g_get_home_dir (), "omp.config", NULL);
01168   connection = connection_from_file (conf_file_path);
01169   g_free (conf_file_path);
01170 
01171   if (manager_host_string != NULL)
01172     connection->host_string = manager_host_string;
01173   else if (connection->host_string == NULL)
01174     connection->host_string = OPENVASMD_ADDRESS;
01175 
01176   if (manager_port_string != NULL)
01177     connection->port = atoi (manager_port_string);
01178   else if (connection->port_string != NULL)
01179     connection->port = atoi (connection->port_string);
01180   else
01181     connection->port = OPENVASMD_PORT;
01182 
01183   if (connection->port <= 0 || connection->port >= 65536)
01184     {
01185       fprintf (stderr, "Manager port must be a number between 0 and 65536.\n");
01186       exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01187     }
01188 
01189   connection->use_certs = use_certs;
01190   if (omp_username != NULL)
01191     connection->username = omp_username;
01192   else if (connection->username == NULL)
01193     connection->username = g_strdup (g_get_user_name ());
01194 
01195   if (ping_timeout < 0)
01196     ping_timeout = DEFAULT_PING_TIMEOUT;
01197   connection->timeout = ping_timeout;
01198 
01199   if (omp_password != NULL)
01200     connection->password = omp_password;
01201   else if (connection->password == NULL && !connection->use_certs && !cmd_ping
01202            && !cmd_get_omp_version)
01203     {
01204       gchar *pw = NULL;
01205       size_t n;
01206 
01207       printf ("Enter password: ");
01208       int ret = read_password (&pw, &n, stdin);
01209       printf ("\n");
01210 
01211       if (ret < 0)
01212         {
01213           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to read password from console!\n");
01214           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01215         }
01216 
01217       /* Remove the trailing newline character. */
01218       pw[ret - 1] = '\0';
01219 
01220       if (strlen (pw) > 0)
01221         connection->password = pw;
01222       else
01223         {
01224           fprintf (stderr, "Password must be set.\n");
01225           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01226         }
01227     }
01228 
01229   if (be_verbose)
01230     {
01231       const char *s;
01232 
01234       printf ("\nWARNING: Verbose mode may reveal passwords!\n\n");
01235       printf ("Will try to connect to host %s, port %d...\n",
01236               connection->host_string, connection->port);
01237 
01238       /* Enable GNUTLS debugging if the envvar, as used by the
01239          standard log functions, is set.  */
01240       if ((s=getenv ("OPENVAS_GNUTLS_DEBUG")))
01241         {
01242           gnutls_global_set_log_function (my_gnutls_log_func);
01243           gnutls_global_set_log_level (atoi (s));
01244         }
01245     }
01246   else
01247     {
01248 #ifndef _WIN32
01249       g_log_set_default_handler (openvas_log_silent, NULL);
01250 #endif
01251     }
01252 
01253   /* Run the single command. */
01254 
01255   if (cmd_create_task)
01256     {
01257       char *id = NULL;
01258 
01259       manager_open (connection);
01260 
01261       if (omp_create_task
01262           (&(connection->session), name ? name : "unnamed task",
01263            config ? config : "Full and fast", target ? target : "Localhost",
01264            comment ? comment : "", &id))
01265         {
01266           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to create task.\n");
01267           manager_close (connection);
01268           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01269         }
01270 
01271       printf ("%s", id);
01272       putchar ('\n');
01273 
01274       manager_close (connection);
01275       exit_status = 0;
01276     }
01277   else if (cmd_delete_report)
01278     {
01279       gchar **point = rest;
01280 
01281       if (point == NULL || *point == NULL)
01282         {
01283           fprintf (stderr, "delete-report requires at least one argument.\n");
01284           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01285         }
01286 
01287       manager_open (connection);
01288 
01289       while (*point)
01290         {
01291           if (omp_delete_report (&(connection->session), *point))
01292             {
01293               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to delete report %s, exiting.\n",
01294                        *point);
01295               manager_close (connection);
01296               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01297             }
01298           point++;
01299         }
01300 
01301       manager_close (connection);
01302       exit_status = 0;
01303     }
01304   else if (cmd_delete_task)
01305     {
01306       gchar **point = rest;
01307 
01308       if (point == NULL || *point == NULL)
01309         {
01310           fprintf (stderr, "delete-task requires at least one argument.\n");
01311           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01312         }
01313 
01314       manager_open (connection);
01315 
01316       while (*point)
01317         {
01318           if (omp_delete_task (&(connection->session), *point))
01319             {
01320               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to delete task.\n");
01321               manager_close (connection);
01322               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01323             }
01324           point++;
01325         }
01326 
01327       manager_close (connection);
01328       exit_status = 0;
01329     }
01330   else if (cmd_get_tasks)
01331     {
01332       gchar **point = rest;
01333       entity_t status;
01334 
01335       manager_open (connection);
01336 
01337       if (point)
01338         while (*point)
01339           {
01340             omp_get_task_opts_t opts;
01341 
01342             opts = omp_get_task_opts_defaults;
01343             opts.task_id = *point;
01344             opts.details = 1;
01345             opts.actions = "g";
01346 
01347             if (omp_get_task_ext (&(connection->session), opts, &status))
01348               {
01349                 fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get status of task %s.\n", *point);
01350                 manager_close (connection);
01351                 exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01352               }
01353             else
01354               {
01355                 if (print_tasks (status->entities))
01356                   {
01357                     manager_close (connection);
01358                     exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01359                   }
01360               }
01361 
01362             point++;
01363           }
01364       else
01365         {
01366           omp_get_tasks_opts_t opts;
01367 
01368           opts = omp_get_tasks_opts_defaults;
01369           opts.details = 0;
01370           opts.filter = "permission=any owner=any rows=-1";
01371 
01372           if (omp_get_tasks_ext (&(connection->session), opts, &status))
01373             {
01374               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get status of all tasks.\n");
01375               manager_close (connection);
01376               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01377             }
01378           if (print_tasks (status->entities))
01379             {
01380               manager_close (connection);
01381               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01382             }
01383         }
01384 
01385       manager_close (connection);
01386       exit_status = 0;
01387     }
01388   else if (cmd_get_configs)
01389     {
01390       entity_t status;
01391 
01392       manager_open (connection);
01393 
01394       if (get_configs (&(connection->session), &status))
01395         {
01396           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get configs.\n");
01397           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01398         }
01399       if (print_configs (status->entities))
01400         {
01401           manager_close (connection);
01402           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01403         }
01404 
01405       manager_close (connection);
01406       exit_status = 0;
01407     }
01408   else if (cmd_get_targets)
01409     {
01410       entity_t status;
01411 
01412       manager_open (connection);
01413 
01414       if (omp_get_targets (&(connection->session), NULL, 0, 0, &status))
01415         {
01416           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to get targets.\n");
01417           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01418         }
01419       if (print_targets (status->entities))
01420         {
01421           manager_close (connection);
01422           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01423         }
01424 
01425       manager_close (connection);
01426       exit_status = 0;
01427     }
01428   else if (cmd_get_report)
01429     {
01430       gchar **report_ids = rest;
01431 
01432       if (report_ids == NULL || *report_ids == NULL)
01433         {
01434           fprintf (stderr, "get-report requires one argument.\n");
01435           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01436         }
01437 
01438       manager_open (connection);
01439       exit_status = manager_get_reports (connection, report_ids, format);
01440       if (exit_status == 0)
01441         manager_close (connection);
01442     }
01443   else if (cmd_get_report_formats)
01444     {
01445       manager_open (connection);
01446       exit_status = manager_get_report_formats (connection);
01447       if (exit_status == 0)
01448         manager_close (connection);
01449     }
01450   else if (cmd_get_omp_version)
01451     {
01452       gchar *version = NULL;
01453       manager_open (connection);
01454       exit_status = manager_get_omp_version (connection, &version);
01455       printf ("Version: %s\n", version);
01456       g_free (version);
01457       if (exit_status == 0)
01458         manager_close (connection);
01459     }
01460   else if (cmd_ping)
01461     {
01462       if (manager_open (connection))
01463         {
01464           fprintf (stderr, "OMP ping failed: Failed to establish connection.\n");
01465           exit_status = 1;
01466         }
01467       else
01468         {
01469           int res;
01470           /* Returns 0 on success, 1 if manager closed connection, 2 on
01471              timeout, -1 on error */
01472           res = omp_ping (&(connection->session), connection->timeout);
01473           if (res == 0)
01474             {
01475               fprintf (stdout, "OMP ping was successful.\n");
01476               exit_status = 0;
01477             }
01478           else if (res == 1)
01479             {
01480               fprintf (stderr, "OMP ping failed: Server closed connection.\n");
01481               exit_status = 1;
01482             }
01483           else if (res == 2)
01484             {
01485               fprintf (stderr, "OMP ping failed: Timeout.\n");
01486               exit_status = 1;
01487             }
01488           else
01489             {
01490               fprintf (stderr, "OMP ping failed: Unknown error.\n");
01491               exit_status = 1;
01492             }
01493         }
01494       if (exit_status == 0)
01495         manager_close (connection);
01496     }
01497   else if (cmd_modify_task)
01498     {
01499       gchar **point = rest;
01500       gchar *content;
01501       gsize content_len;
01502 
01503       if (point == NULL || *point == NULL)
01504         {
01505           fprintf (stderr, "modify-task requires one argument.\n");
01506           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01507         }
01508 
01509       if (name == NULL)
01510         {
01511           fprintf (stderr,
01512                    "modify-task requires the name option (path to file).\n");
01513           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01514         }
01515 
01516       if (file == FALSE)
01517         {
01518           fprintf (stderr, "modify-task requires the file option.\n");
01519           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01520         }
01521 
01522       if (file)
01523         {
01524           GIOChannel *stdin_channel;
01525           manager_open (connection);
01526 
01527           /* Mixing stream and file descriptor IO might lead to trouble. */
01528           error = NULL;
01529           stdin_channel = g_io_channel_unix_new (fileno (stdin));
01530           g_io_channel_read_to_end (stdin_channel, &content, &content_len,
01531                                     &error);
01532           g_io_channel_shutdown (stdin_channel, TRUE, NULL);
01533           g_io_channel_unref (stdin_channel);
01534           if (error)
01535             {
01536               fprintf (stderr, "failed to read from stdin: %s\n",
01537                        error->message);
01538               g_error_free (error);
01539               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01540             }
01541 
01542 #if 0
01543 
01544           exit_status =
01545             manager_modify_task_file (connection, *point, name, content,
01546                                       content_len, error);
01547 #else
01548           if (omp_modify_task_file
01549               (&(connection->session), *point, name, content, content_len))
01550             {
01551               g_free (content);
01552               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to modify task.\n");
01553               manager_close (connection);
01554               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01555             }
01556 
01557           manager_close (connection);
01558           exit_status = 0;
01559 #endif
01560         }
01561     }
01562   else if (cmd_start_task)
01563     {
01564       gchar **point = rest;
01565 
01566       if (point == NULL || *point == NULL)
01567         {
01568           fprintf (stderr, "start-task requires at least one argument.\n");
01569           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01570         }
01571 
01572       manager_open (connection);
01573 
01574       while (*point)
01575         {
01576           char *report_id;
01577           if (omp_start_task_report
01578               (&(connection->session), *point, &report_id))
01579             {
01580               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to start task.\n");
01581               manager_close (connection);
01582               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01583             }
01584           printf ("%s\n", report_id);
01585           free (report_id);
01586           point++;
01587         }
01588       exit_status = 0;
01589 
01590       manager_close (connection);
01591     }
01592   else if (cmd_xml)
01593     {
01594       manager_open (connection);
01595 
01596       if (send_file_path)
01597         {
01598           char *new_xml = cmd_xml;
01599           if (replace_send_file_xml (&new_xml, send_file_path))
01600             exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01601           g_free (cmd_xml);
01602           cmd_xml = new_xml;
01603         }
01604 
01606       if (prompt)
01607         {
01608           fprintf (stderr, "Connected, press a key to continue.\n");
01609           getchar ();
01610         }
01611 
01612       if (strcmp (cmd_xml, "-") == 0)
01613         {
01614           GError *error;
01615           gchar *content;
01616           gsize content_len;
01617           GIOChannel *stdin_channel;
01618 
01619           /* Mixing stream and file descriptor IO might lead to trouble. */
01620           error = NULL;
01621           stdin_channel = g_io_channel_unix_new (fileno (stdin));
01622           g_io_channel_read_to_end (stdin_channel, &content, &content_len,
01623                                     &error);
01624           g_io_channel_shutdown (stdin_channel, TRUE, NULL);
01625           g_io_channel_unref (stdin_channel);
01626           if (error)
01627             {
01628               fprintf (stderr, "Failed to read from stdin: %s\n",
01629                        error->message);
01630               g_error_free (error);
01631               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01632             }
01633 
01634           g_free (cmd_xml);
01635           cmd_xml = content;
01636         }
01637 
01638       if (be_verbose)
01639         printf ("Sending to manager: %s\n", cmd_xml);
01640 
01641       if (openvas_server_send (&(connection->session), cmd_xml) == -1)
01642         {
01643           manager_close (connection);
01644           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to send_to_manager.\n");
01645           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01646         }
01647 
01648       /* Read the response. */
01649 
01650       entity_t entity = NULL;
01651       if (read_entity (&(connection->session), &entity))
01652         {
01653           fprintf (stderr, "Failed to read response.\n");
01654           manager_close (connection);
01655           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
01656         }
01657 
01658       if (be_verbose)
01659         printf ("Got response:\n");
01660       if (pretty_print == FALSE)
01661         print_entity (stdout, entity);
01662       else
01663         print_entity_format (entity, GINT_TO_POINTER (2));
01664       printf ("\n");
01665 
01666       /* Cleanup. */
01667 
01669       if (prompt)
01670         {
01671           fprintf (stderr, "Press a key when done.\n");
01672           getchar ();
01673         }
01674 
01675       manager_close (connection);
01676       free_entity (entity);
01677 
01678       exit_status = 0;
01679     }
01680   else
01681     /* The option processing ensures that at least one command is present. */
01682     assert (0);
01683 
01684   /* Exit. */
01685 
01686   if (be_verbose)
01687     {
01688       if (exit_status)
01689         printf ("Command failed.\n");
01690       else
01691         printf ("Command completed successfully.\n");
01692     }
01693 
01694   exit (exit_status);
01695 }
